channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Interstellar Arc Serves Up Alien Foxes, Exoplanets, and VR Carl Sagan
item.description: Interstellar Arc is an immersive sci-fi experience that uses recent advances in headset tech to break new ground in virtual reality. And it all happen...

item.title: 7 Best Desktop Computers (2025): Gaming, Macs, Compact, and More
item.description: Despite advancements in laptops, desktop computers still have a place. These are the WIRED-tested options you should consider.

item.title: Mirelo raises $41M from Index and a16z to solve AI video’s silent problem
item.description: Mirelo, a German startup that is building AI to add synced sound effects to videos, has raised a $41 million seed round led by Index Ventures and Andr...

item.title: Snapchat rolls out its end-of-year Recaps
item.description: The Recap is a short video that offers a personalized look at highlights from Snaps, Stories, and Chats, showing how users connected and expressed the...

item.title: This Startup Wants to Build Self-Driving Car Software—Super Fast
item.description: The autonomous vehicle industry is heating up thanks to advances in AI. But can those same innovations help startups like HyprLabs build safe tech?

item.title: Nvidia Becomes a Major Model Maker With Nemotron 3
item.description: The world’s top chipmaker wants open source AI to succeed—perhaps because closed models increasingly run on its rivals’ silicon.

item.title: Nvidia reportedly weighs ramping up H200 production to meet surging demand in China
item.description: After successfully lobbying the Trump administration to approve the sales of its H200 chips to China, Nvidia is now thinking of adding capacity to pro...

item.title: First Voyage raises $2.5M for its AI companion helps you build habits
item.description: First Voyage has raised $2.5 million in a seed funding round from a16z speed run, SignalFire, True Global, and other investors.

item.title: Radiation-Detection Systems Are Quietly Running in the Background All Around You
item.description: If a major disaster like Fukushima or Chernobyl ever happens again, the world would know almost straight away, thanks to an array of government and DI...

item.title: Tesla starts testing robotaxis in Austin with no safety driver
item.description: It's one of the last big steps before the company can truly claim it's operating a robotaxi service, and start to take on Waymo.
